member.name: T:LabApi.Features.Audio.AudioTransmitter
member.summary: Encodes and sends audio to certain players which plays on speakers with the specified controller id.
member.remarks: Its possible to create multiple transmitters with the same controller id, but you must filter the receiving players such that no one player receives audio from multiple transmitters. This is done to allow you to send different audio to certain players using the same speakers.

member.name: F:LabApi.Features.Audio.AudioTransmitter.SampleRate
member.summary: The sample rate in samples per second.

member.name: F:LabApi.Features.Audio.AudioTransmitter.FrameSize
member.summary: The number of samples per audio frame.

member.name: F:LabApi.Features.Audio.AudioTransmitter.FramePeriod
member.summary: The number of seconds between each audio frame.

member.name: F:LabApi.Features.Audio.AudioTransmitter.MaxEncodedSize
member.summary: The max number of bytes allowed to be encoded per audio frame.

member.name: M:LabApi.Features.Audio.AudioTransmitter.#ctor(System.Byte,VoiceChat.Codec.Enums.OpusApplicationType)
member.summary: Creates a new audio transmitter for the specified controller.
member.param: The controller specified by its Id.
What kind of audio the encoder should optimise's for.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Audio.AudioTransmitter.ControllerId
member.summary: The of the speakers to play the audio on.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Audio.AudioTransmitter.AudioClipSamples
member.summary: The queued audio clips. Includes the current playing clip.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Audio.AudioTransmitter.ValidPlayers
member.summary: The predicate for determining which players receive audio.
member.remarks: If , all authenticated players will receive audio packets.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Audio.AudioTransmitter.Looping
member.summary: Whether the last queued clip will loop.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Audio.AudioTransmitter.CurrentPosition
member.summary: The position in samples of the current clip.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Audio.AudioTransmitter.CurrentSampleCount
member.summary: Number of samples in the current clip.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Audio.AudioTransmitter.IsPlaying
member.summary: Whether playback is active and can be stopped or paused.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Audio.AudioTransmitter.IsPaused
member.summary: Whether playback is paused and can be resumed.

member.name: M:LabApi.Features.Audio.AudioTransmitter.Play(System.Single[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Plays the PCM samples on the current controller.
member.remarks: Samples are played at a sample rate of , mono channel (non interleaved data) with ranges from -1.0f to 1.0f.
member.param: Whether to queue the audio if audio is already playing, otherwise overrides the current audio.
Whether to loop this clip. Loop ends if another clip is played either immediately if not queued or at the end of the loop if next clip was queued.

member.name: M:LabApi.Features.Audio.AudioTransmitter.Pause
member.summary: Pauses transmission of audio.

member.name: M:LabApi.Features.Audio.AudioTransmitter.Resume
member.summary: Resumes transmission of audio.

member.name: M:LabApi.Features.Audio.AudioTransmitter.Skip(System.Int32)
member.summary: Skips the current or queued clips. Includes the current clip.
member.param: The number of queued audios clips to skip.

member.name: M:LabApi.Features.Audio.AudioTransmitter.Stop
member.summary: Stops transmission of audio.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.AdminToy.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the local position of the admin toy. Position is relative to its parent if it has one, otherwise its the world position.
member.remarks: If is client wont update its position.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.AdminToy.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the local rotation of the admin toy. Rotation is relative to its parent if it has one, otherwise its the world rotation.
member.remarks: If is client wont update its rotation.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.AdminToy.Scale
member.summary: Gets or sets the local scale of the admin toy. Scale is relative to its parent if it has one, otherwise its the world scale.
member.remarks: If is client wont update its scale.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.AdminToy.Parent
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent of the admin toy.
member.remarks:
If the parent object contains a component and has been the parent is synced with the client.
Can be used even if is . When changing parent the toys relative , and are retained. Note that if the parent has called on it this object automatically has called on itself. To prevent destruction make sure you unparent it before that happens.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.AdminToy.MovementSmoothing
member.summary: Gets or sets the movement smoothing value.
member.remarks: Smooths the transitions between positions, rotations and scales. Higher values means more smoothing. 0 means no movement smoothing so it will snap between positions, rotations and scales. Smoothing does not work with parenting changes so changing parent will always cause a teleport.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.AdminToy.IsStatic
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the admin toy is static. This should be enabled on as many toys possible to increase performance. Static is only applies to the local transformations so parenting to something that moves will still causes it to move while retaining the performance boost.
member.remarks: A static admin toy will not process , or on both server and client drastically increasing performance. can still be used even if static is .

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.AdminToy.SyncInterval
member.summary: Time interval in seconds for sending updated values to the client. 0 means update every frame while 0.5 means update every 500ms. Lower values increase network usage but mean the client receives the most up to date state from the server.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.AdminToy.CanCache
member.summary: Whether to cache this wrapper.

member.name: M:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.AdminToy.Spawn
member.summary: Spawns the toy on the client.
member.remarks: Spawn wont cascade to children toy objects, so if they are not spawned you have to call spawn on all of them.

member.name: M:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.AdminToy.Destroy
member.summary: Destroys the toy on server and client.
member.remarks: Cascades to all children toy objects, be sure to unparent children if you don't intend to destroy them.

member.name: M:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.AdminToy.OnRemove
member.summary: An internal method to remove itself from the cache when the base object is destroyed.

member.summary: Gets or set the min and max zoom level of the camera.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether a search can be started by the client.
member.remarks: If the toy is considered searchable see , this prevents a search from being initiated by the client if . Useful if you want behaviour similar to pickups where only 1 player can search the toy at once. Note. Unlike pickups this property is not set automatically and by default is never used.

member.summary:
Gets path from to .
Path is found via Dijkstra's algorithm. Path still works between zones (including via elevators) as it uses .
If no path is found, an empty list is returned.

member.returns: A pooled list containing rooms from to (including these rooms).

member.name: T:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.FirearmItem
member.summary:
The wrapper representing .
Firearms are functioning as they close as they would in real life. This means that there are properties for whether the bolt is closed or opened, whether the hammer is cocked for specific firearms, whether the magazine is inserted and so many other properties you may need to be aware of when adjusting this firearm item.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.FirearmItem.MagazineInserted
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether this firearm has inserted magazine.
An empty magazine is inserted when set to .
Remaining ammo from the magazine is inserted back into player's inventory when removed.
member.remarks: Firearms with no external or internal magazine will always return .

member.summary: Gets or sets the stored ammo in a ammo container for this firearm.

member.summary: Gets the maximum ammo the firearm can have in its ammo container. Attachment modifiers are taken into account when calculating it.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.FirearmItem.ChamberedAmmo
member.summary:
Gets or sets the current ammo in the chamber.
firearms do not use this value and take ammo directly from it's ammo container.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.FirearmItem.ChamberMax
member.summary:
Gets or sets the maximum ammo in chamber. Visual side may be incorrect.

member.summary: An internal constructor to prevent external instantiation.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.RevolverFirearm.Chambers
member.summary:
Gets collection of all active chambers. The first chamber is the one aligned with the barrel.
Each subsequent index corresponds to the next chambers that will become aligned with the barrel when the cylinder rotates in its intended direction.
Note that double-action revolvers rotate the cylinder right before firing, which means the 0th element isn't necessarily the next round to be fired (unless the revolver is already cocked).

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.RevolverFirearm.StoredAmmo
member.summary: Gets or sets the stored ammo in a ammo container for this firearm.
member.remarks: Stored ammo in revolver firearm cannot exceed its and any additional values are ignored.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.RevolverFirearm.ChamberedAmmo
member.summary:
Gets or sets the current ammo in the chamber.
Revolver's only accounts for the currently aligned chamber with the barrel. Therefore the maximum of chambered ammo is 1 (live round) or 0 (empty / discharged). Any value greater than 1 is counted as live round.

member.name: M:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.RevolverFirearm.SetChamberStatus(System.Int32,InventorySystem.Items.Firearms.Modules.CylinderAmmoModule.ChamberState)
member.summary:
Sets the status of the chamber at . 0th element is the one currently aligned with the barrel.
Indexes of each round are clockwise.
member.param: Index of the chamber clockwise. Starting at barrel aligned chamber.

member.name: M:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.RevolverFirearm.Rotate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Rotates the chamber counter-clockwise (positive numbers) or clockwise (negative numbers) times. No animation is played client-side.
member.param: The amount of times to rotate this cylinder.

member.name: M:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.RevolverFirearm.TrySpin
member.summary: Attempts to spin the revolver if the firearm isn't busy doing something else.
member.returns: Whether the spin request was successful.

member.name: M:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.ShotgunFirearm.Pump(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Schedules pumping for this firearm.
Value of 0 pumps the firearm instantly. Any value above 0 delays the pump by * 0.5 second.
member.param: The amount of shots that has been fired. Pumping is delayed by * 0.5 second.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.Player.List
member.summary: A reference to all instances currently in the game.
member.remarks:
This list includes the host player, NPCs and unauthenticated players.
Unauthenticated players you must be especially careful with as interacting with them incorrectly will cause them to softlock while joining the game. Use to get connected players that you can send network messages to.

Match the regex.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.Player.ArtificialHealth
member.summary:
Gets or sets the player's current artificial health.
Setting the value will clear all the current "processes" (each process is responsible for decaying AHP value separately. E.g 2 processes blue candy AHP, which doesn't decay and adrenaline process, where AHP does decay).
Note: This value cannot be greater than . Set it to your desired value first if its over and then set this one.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.Player.MaxArtificialHealth
member.summary:
Gets or sets the player's current maximum artificial health or hume shield.
Note: The value resets to when the player's AHP reaches 0.

member.name: P:LabApi.Features.Wrappers.Player.Gravity
member.summary:
Gets or sets the player's current gravity. Default value is .
If the player's current role is not first person controlled (inherit from then is returned.
Y-axis is up and down. Negative values makes the player go down. Positive upwards. Player must not be grounded in order for gravity to take effect.

member.name: P:LabApi.Loader.Features.Plugins.Plugin.IsTransparent
member.summary:
Whether this plugin is considered transparent.
A plugin can be marked as transparent if the servers modifications are strictly limited to non-intrusive features that do not affect gameplay balance or make significant alterations to the user interface. Examples of transparent modifications are: admin tools, automated timed broadcasts for tips, message of the day or other administrative utilities.
For more information, see article 5.2 in the official documentation: https://scpslgame.com/csg.
member.remarks: You can keep using the 'transparently modded' flag during occasional short events organized and supervised by Server Staff, regardless of the Modifications used for these events.
